description: vegan and vegetarian friendly.  The prices are fair, and the food is ok.  Some things are better than others, and the selection is sometimes not the greatest.  Definitely an option but not on the top of my list.
author: Joshua S.

description: OK so you really have to put this place into perspective of where it is (downtown) and what other comparable Chinese restaurants in that area offer.  Financial district is riddled with dressed up, crappy fast-food Chinese restaurants which this place is not.  They have a good/decent veggie section and have a wide variety of meat dishes.  What it's not is eloquent and to say fun is a stretch, but if you are like me and work downtown, care about what you put into your system and like to pay no more that $8 for lunch then this place is worth it.
author: G L.

description: So I was walking by this afternoon and thought on the off chance they would have wor won ton soup.  Well they looked at me like I had 3 heads yet made me soup.  Not so much.  It was okay, I was full after 2 won tons, but it had broccoli and all this funky barbecued pork and beef in it.  Sounds good right.  Wrong.  And tons of MSG.  This is a place you can skip.
author: Nicole F.

description: I can get out of there under a pound of food and it will fill me up.  I've had just about everything there and its all better than the average Chinese buffet.  The biggest complaint is the slow people in line who don't know what they want to eat.  Move over!  The best thing is that day after day the food taste the same. There is an upstairs that is hardly used but its a little to warm for my taste. I do pass by a few other Chinese places to get to this one because, I love that I can just get in and out within 3-4 minutes with some pretty good food.  It is what it is: A pay by the pound Chinese buffet.
author: Angela Y.

description: I work just above this place, so I usually only go there because it's convenient.  Decent Chinese buffet at a reasonable price.  Only go there if you need to fill up.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
buffet style "chinese food"

they have a couple of tables out on the main level, and more upstairs in the dining hall.  fried rice was dry.  "bbq chicken" (chicken breast in a soy-based sauce) was okay and they have lots of vegetables!

not bad, i'd say.
author: Ray R.

description: The my general response to 'Chinese buffet lunch' is 'meh'. But this one is a lil different. I get my fix of Chinese food at this place once a week or so. Never have I seen dried up and cold food trays. A lot of meat and vege selections. love love love their spicy chicken wings....slightly crispy dipped in chilli sauce/paste and vinegar and what not..yum yum..tastes much more delish than it sounds. Make sure you have a pitcher of water around :-)
author: MrsNIFTY G.

description: i bought food here and shit their rice is hecka greasy and yes the people who works in here are not very helpful at all. the place sucks their lemon chicken is almost good except that it made me sick after eating it.must be all the msg they put on their food..
author: Ces T.

description: this is the greatest place to get great food by the pound.  when i worked at williams-sonoma i made sure that when i was caving chinese, I fulfilled my craving with something tasty from china fun express. the only things is the place is really small, its totally a grab and go place...which is good sometimes.
author: Sloane G.

description: A lot of good selection.  So many choices to choose from.  But don't get too crazy b/c the price is based on weight....you could end up paying $10 for chinese food which i think is a little too much.  quick service here though and if you spent over $5-6, you get free soup.  the food's generally pretty good
author: Mich C.

description: Self-service chinese buffet by the pound. Fairly priced and fairly cooked. A rather large non-vege section and a six item vegetarian section, though I've often gone only to find four of the six vege trays have run out and not been refilled - super frustrating! When available, I prefer the kung pao tofu and the broccoli with garlic sauce. If you desire greasy chinese fast for cheap, this place will meet your needs.
author: Alex D.

description: came here with four of my co workers... you pick your own food and the cashier weighs it and that what you get charge.... food there not so great ... food might be cold and rice is kinda of dry and hard...
author: Lily T.

description: i love this place more than a fat kid loves cake. there is just something in the atmosphere here that makes the dinning experience everything that is incredible. i work in the area and this is my all time favorite pace to eat. the food is amazing and the staff is always delightful.
author: The D.

description: Being on a budget and wanting some good food is hard to find at time, but when you need a quick Chinese food fix - this is the place to go.  One plus is that it is really clean for a self-service place and pretty fresh.  They sell it by the pound and it's fairly reasonable.
author: Alisha P.
